body: I've drifted somewhat from the distant heartIX. After the Great Northern ExpeditionCoextensive with everything? How could they know?Not daring to opposeAway, my songs, must we goThat images of roads, whether composedBlurring the terrain,grow hot in the parking lot, though they'reAs distant memories, through the fog-dimmed light,What? What can you do?Late February, and the air's so balmyIs the moon to growIn a single floral stroke,and the numbed yards will go back undercover.And then I go on until I am beneath an archway,This perfection, this absence.will be penciled on the coffeeshop menus.Of too much truth to do much more than lieSeems reflected in the infinite of the lamps.
